page.title: 02Land Distribution Part 1
page.content: The field from Warren Lane to Salmons Farm Lane contains sheep and grass. It's surrounded by hedgerows of hawthorn, blackthorn and oak trees. There's a stream containing rushes along the field.There's a bridge over the{Eden}which goes through a weir. The field opposite the school grows grass for grazing cattle. Where the {Eden}and{Medway}meet the field is divided by hedgerows and oak trees. Behind Swaylands School there are some hop fields which belong to Elliott's Farm. At the right of the road B2176 leading up Rogues Hill is all cattle grazing. The B2188 going to Fordcombe has a housing estate which used to be part of an orchard. Most of the fields near the river are for grazing cattle.
